trustfund:
TF020460-NORWEGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF031190-BANGLADESH - TRANSPORT,TF026800-PHRD-THIRD INLAND WATER
            TRANSPORT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is adjudged
            satisfactory, although there were inordinate delays in
            implementing the operational improvement and financial
            recovery plans of the executing agencies. Project
            sustainability is unlikely basically because the Government
            of Bangladesh's commitment to pursue much broader
            policy and institutional reforms, including divestiture,
            appears weak. Overall World Bank performance was
            satisfactory, while Borrower performance was unsatisfactory
            since it failed to achieve most of the important reform
            objectives. Lessons learned included the need to plan reform
            programs through a participatory process; to actively
            involve senior officials and closely monitor project
            implementation; to reduce delays in approval of procurement
            related activities by increasing the financial authority of
            the parastatals; to enhance the role of the private sector;
            and to engage the government in activities prior to Credit
            approval which would cement its commitment to reform, such
            as its taking irreversible actions like enacting legislation
            prior to effectiveness.
